step.title: Storing the components in a normal area

paragraph.prodType: Cell | Damaged cell | Module | Damaged module | Pack | Damaged pack
paragraph.htmltext:
A normal storage area is an area where no measures are taken to cope with the risks of lithium-ion batteries. These can for example be areas to store temporally batteries.

In case there is a fire, the fire brigade need to know where dangerous goods are stored. It is therefore recommended to at information of battery storage to the intervention plan.

When the batteries are stored in a normal area the same risk of thermal runaway exists. The effect of the consequences of the thermal runway can be much worse. If a cells are placed in this type of area, the measures to detect thermal runaway and avoid propagation are valid. More awareness and monitoring is needed .
